p: The extent to which geographical thinning was successful in removing spatial autocorrelation caused by clustering of presence records was examined by plotting correlograms of the residuals of each fitted sub-model using the correlog function in the ncf package in R [ 53]. The Moranâ€™s I values and significance values were then averaged across sub-models within different distance bins (from 0 to 80 km in increments of 5 km), to look for evidence of systematic positive spatial autocorrelation.
